description:
About the job
As an intern, you will play a crucial role in analyzing financial data, conducting market research, and providing valuable insights that drive informed decision-making. This internship provides hands-on experience in leveraging business analysis techniques within the finance industry, contributing to the growth and success of our organization.

Job Summary
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst Intern to join our Finance department. The intern will work closely with the finance team, supporting various initiatives to enhance financial performance, optimize processes, and improve overall financial management. The Business Analyst Intern will play a vital role in collecting and analyzing financial data, generating insights, and making recommendations to drive informed decision-making within the department.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the finance team to gather and document business requirements for financial analysis and reporting.
Assist in the analysis and interpretation of financial data, including budgeting, forecasting, variance analysis, and financial modeling.
Support the development and maintenance of financial models, tools, and reports to track and evaluate financial performance and key metrics.
Conduct research and analysis on financial trends, market conditions, and industry benchmarks to provide insights and recommendations.
Assist in the preparation of financial presentations and reports for senior management and stakeholders.
Help identify process improvement opportunities in financial operations and propose innovative solutions to streamline workflows.
Participate in the preparation and analysis of financial budgets, including revenue projections, cost estimates, and expense forecasts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather insights and ensure alignment on financial goals and initiatives.
Stay updated on financial regulations, accounting standards, and best practices relevant to the water utility industry.
Collaborate with other interns and team members on departmental projects and initiatives as needed.
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret financial data and statements.
Proficiency in financial analysis tools, such as Microsoft Excel, financial modeling software, and data visualization tools.
Knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting standards.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey financial insights and recommendations.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.
Knowledge or interest in the water industry and utility finance is a plus.
